qas.question: Who privatized the airlines of Mexico?
What did NAFTA do to the businesses in Mexico City?

answers.text: led to decentralization and a shift in Mexico City's economic base, from manufacturing to services

qas.question: Where did the factories of Mexico City move to most commonly?

context: The economic reforms of <a0_0><a1_0>President Carlos Salinas de Gortari<a1_0/><a0_0/> had a tremendous effect on the city, as a number of businesses, including banks and airlines, were privatized. He also signed the North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA). This <a2_0>led to decentralization and a shift in Mexico City's economic base, from manufacturing to services<a2_0/>, as most factories moved away to either the State of Mexico, or more commonly to the <a3_0>northern border<a3_0/>. By contrast, corporate office buildings set their base in the city.
